page.title: 12Fordoun By-pass
page.content: Parts of the A94 have recently been changed into a dual crriageway to provide a better link between Aberdeen & Dundee. The Fordoun by pass section was started in 1983 and finished 2\ years later in august 1985. Since the A94's upgrading the journey to Aberdeen takes 30 minutes instead of 45. More lorries are using the cafe although the hotel's trade has dropped since the road workers have left. New bus bays have been made on the road althouh the secondary school bus has changed route and now goes along the A92 for some distance. Primary school children from Fordoun now travel along a slightly longer but safer route using a new underpass to get to Redmyre Primary School.
